headline: NextEra Energy Transmission and Exelon Welcome PJM Board Vote to Advance Grid Reliability Project
summary: NextEra Energy Transmission, LLC, a subsidiary of NextEra Energy, Inc. (NYSE: NEE), and Exelon Corporation (Nasdaq: EXC) today welcomed the PJM Board of Directors' approval of their proposed ~220-mile, 765-kV transmission line. The project will enhance electric reliability and affordability for West Virginia, Pennsylvania and the MidAtlantic region.

raw.headline: NextEra Energy Transmission and Exelon Welcome PJM Board Vote to Advance Grid Reliability Project

The project will enhance electric reliability and affordability for West Virginia, Pennsylvania and the MidAtlantic region.

headline: Assessing Exelon (EXC) Valuation After Recent Share Price Momentum And 1 Year Return
summary: Exelon (EXC) has drawn investor attention after recent share price moves, with the stock showing gains over the past week, month, and past 3 months as income-focused investors reassess this large U.S. utility. See our latest analysis for Exelon. Those short term moves sit alongside a steadier backdrop, with an 8.3% year to date share price return and a 1 year total shareholder return of 14.7%. This suggests momentum has been building rather than fading around the recent US$47.55 level. If...

headline: Exelon: Not Just A Bet On AI Data Center Tailwinds, But On Electrification Overall
summary: Exelon Corporation delivered strong Q4 and full-year results, with adjusted EPS of $0.59 beating estimates. Learn more about EXC stock here.

headline: Transmission drives Exelon’s capital spending plan to $41.3B
summary: Exelon has a “line of sight” on $12 billion to $17 billion of transmission buildout over the next 10 years that isn’t included in its current capital plan, a company official said.
